column4: Hi, can someone help me find the proper driver for my Atheros network device?
Is it an onboard network device or a USB one?
it is an onboard device
I believe it is an AtherosEG5007 or soemthing like that
What kind of laptop is it?
its a Toshiba Satellite
I got a Satellite, too, but mine uses Intel drivers
Satallite A215
Mine's an A205
I want to find a driver that will allow packet injection
The Intel drivers I have support injection automatically
I just have to modprobe to the ipwraw drivers
I was using airmon-ng and it was telling me that my device didn't support injection
Yeah...Its not the drivers...Its the card itself...That particular card isn't supported
I was looking at a table about my device and it showed that it is capable of injection with the right driver
oh damn
so, if I wanted to do injection, I'd need to buy a new network card?
Most Atheros cards won't work with BackTrack 3...Intel drivers, D-Link, and Linksys are the only three drivers that have injection capabilites
lame, ok thanks
I also have another question. Is it possible for me to install linux, then add software to my harddrive, then make a new live cd that will run live with that new software?
The D-Link WUA1310 wireless USB dongle is the best one to use
thank you
Make sure you download the RaLink rt75 drivers for that card.  The rt75 drivers support injection
awesome, you rock
